metadata.title: CVE-2023-4387 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in vmxnet3_rq_alloc_rx_buf indrivers/net/vmxnet3/vmxnet3_drv.c in VMware's vmxnet3 ethernet NIC driverin the Linux Kernel. This issue could allow a local attacker to crash thesystem due to a double-free while cleaning up vmxnet3_rq_cleanup_all, whichcould also lead to a kernel information leak problem.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4387` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-191-generic - 4.15.0-191.202
linux-image-4.15.0-191-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-191.202
linux-image-4.15.0-191-lowlatency - 4.15.0-191.202
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-191-generic - 4.15.0-191.202
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-191-lowlatency - 4.15.0-191.202
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-126-generic - 5.4.0-126.142~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-126-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-126.142~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-126-lowlatency - 5.4.0-126.142~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-126-generic - 5.4.0-126.142~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-126-lowlatency - 5.4.0-126.142~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1125-kvm - 4.15.0-1125.130
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1139-aws - 4.15.0-1139.150
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1085-aws - 5.4.0-1085.92~18.04.1
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-191.202').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4, was needs-triage').
